timeline.bodyText: @kaisun2000 Could you rebase this PR with master?
timeline.author: huizhilu

timeline.bodyText: It seems this log is for your debugging. Do we want to remove it then?
timeline.author: huizhilu

replies.bodyText: No, we don't. We specifically need this. This is a building block to identify leakage.
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText: What's the usage of stacktrace? If this is for human debug, I would suggest making it debug log.
replies.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: This is testing code. Make it info won't pollute log. Will change to debug anyway.
replies.author: kaisun2000

timeline.message:
Eliminate resource leak related to ZkHelixClusterVerifier (#1184)

ZkHelixClusterVerifier and its subclass built with ZK addres would
create an internal ZkClient. Without properly closing the ZkClient
or using global ZkClient in the test base. There would be four
threads and one ZooKeeper client object leaked. The leaked threads
would be in thousands and thus be one of the main contributor
preventing the unit test from finishing. This pull request address
this issue.

timeline.bodyText: AfterSuite is done after all test classes have been executed. So if you attach the class name, it won't be very informative, IMHO. What's the usage of this log?
timeline.author: jiajunwang

timeline.bodyText:
Just curious, why somewhere we use _gZkCLient, but other places we keep using the ZK_ADDR?
If this is because of the test creates more ZKServers, then will the people who add more verifiers with the raw address make more leakage later?
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: Note, here, in TestDriver, we don't have _gZkClient as it is not a subclass of ZkTestBase.java
replies.author: kaisun2000

timeline.bodyText: I don't think watcher is created here. It was created when sync start is called.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: You are right. Originally, the idea is that sync_start time, you don't see which one is created as you want the creation context of the object, not the creation context of the starting thread. Later, it turned the two places are the same test class. so it does not really matter. Let me remove this one.
replies.author: kaisun2000

timeline.bodyText: This is not testing code, please be careful not to pollute the log in production. I think recording this info in the related thread would be good enough to support detecting leakage in test.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

replies.bodyText: There are many time when I debugged, I wish to know where the zkclient is created when I look at the zkclient event thread logs. I think this is actually very useful. In fact, I would event want to add the _uid to each line of logs from Zkclient. It would save a lot time.
replies.author: kaisun2000

replies.bodyText:
Basically, for a log from a thread, such as ZkClient event thread or asycn retry thread, you have the thread id in the log. grepping thread id, you will find the _uid, grepping the _uid, you see the context of where the zkclient is created, such from zkhelixmanager or whatever other Helix java api. This is basically also the technique used to track the watcher leakage.
The log would not be excessive as only one zkclient creation has 3 more lines.
For now, let me change it to debug, if this is ok. We can discussed adding this thing to callbackhandler and zkclient later.
replies.author: kaisun2000

timeline.author: jiajunwang
jiajunwang

timeline.bodyText: Same here, what's the usage of this output?
timeline.author: jiajunwang

timeline.message:
Add sync() call first for new session handling (#1118)

Helix may see stale data when session expires and get reconnected to
a slower ZKServer. This would cause various correctness problem.
We would call sync() to ZKserver first. This ensures Helix would
not see data that saw before.
some further refactor based on feedback.
treat sync() metric the same as Zk server metric
some change based on huizhi's feedback.
change to make sure not understanding return code is logged.

Eliminate resource leak related to ZkHelixClusterVerifier (#1184)

ZkHelixClusterVerifier and its subclass built with ZK addres would
create an internal ZkClient. Without properly closing the ZkClient
or using global ZkClient in the test base. There would be four
threads and one ZooKeeper client object leaked. The leaked threads
would be in thousands and thus be one of the main contributor
preventing the unit test from finishing. This pull request address
this issue.

stablize one test a little bit more if logging enabled. The gist
is still verifier has timing issue. It may validate too early.
change logging based on jj's feedback.
change logging based on jj's feedback.
